title: Childhood Friendships Shape the Brain
description: A short lesson to help you apply Childhood Friendships Shape the Brain.

hook.text: A child without friends at age 5 is more likely to struggle with mental health at 25. The data is clear.

buildup.text: Early friendships teach social skills, empathy, conflict resolution, and emotional regulation.

discovery.text: Children with at least one reciprocal friendship show 40% better academic performance.

climax.text: Childhood friendship isn't just playing. It's the training ground for every relationship that follows.

quiz.question: What do early friendships teach children?
